project:
In this visual novel, you play as Cooper, the golden retriever on a mission to... well... retrieve his lost toys. You'll need to sniff around the neighborhood, gather clues, and figure out where those toys have run off to. Let the fetch quest begin!

[col1]How to play:[col0] press [col1]\[Space][col0] to go to the next dialogue and [col1]\[Up] / \[Down][col0] to select an option when available.

[i]Today, I was searching everywhere for my toys but couldn't find them. My sister Cecile keeps saying, "Cooper, you're a mess... You probably buried your toys somewhere and forgot where they are." But I'm certain I left them near my bed.[/i]
[i]Anyway... I'll head inside and see if they have any ideas on what we could do.[/i]
[col1]You:[col0] Cecile! Where are you? I need your help to figure out who stole my toys and where they’ve gone.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] I’ve told you a million times! You probably just forgot where you left them. Now, can you please leave me alone?
[i]Cecile seems a bit annoyed with me. I’ll try to...[/i]
...tell her to stop being grumpy and help her brother out.
...offer some of the treats I snagged from the kitchen as a bribe for help.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] You’re the reason I’m losing my cool. Seriously, you’ve been nagging me for two days to help find your toys. I didn’t lose them, so I’m not wasting my time looking for them.
[i]Well, that didn’t go as planned. Maybe if I...[/i]
...ask her really nicely and throw in my best puppy eyes, I might just convince her to help me.
...offer some of the treats I snagged from the kitchen, she will help me.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Now we're talking. Alright, how about we head outside and ask the neighbors if anyone saw anything?

[col1]Cecile:[col0] Hey, let’s check with Mia Meow and see if she’s noticed anyone suspicious sneaking into the house. She’s always snooping around the neighborhood, watching everyone come and go, so she must have seen something.
[col1]You:[col0] Umm... I don't know, Cecile. I don’t really trust cats!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Mia! We need your help. Have you seen anyone suspicious around our house? Cooper insists someone took his toys, but we have no idea what happened to them.

[col1]Mia:[col0] Hmm, well... I noticed some paw prints leading to the park. They seem to start near your house, but given their size, they might belong to Rufus. Why don’t we go confront him about it?
[col1]You:[col0] Are you kidding? Rufus is a big guy. He won’t take kindly to any confrontation.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Do you have a better idea, Cooper?
[i]That's a tricky situation. Maybe I should...[/i]
...agree to talk to Rufus and see what’s going on.
...suggest that I offer him my treats before bringing it up.
[col1]You:[col0] Alright, let’s go talk to him. But let’s take it easy, okay? Mia can jump onto the nearest roof if things go south, but Cecile and I don’t have that option!
[col1]Mia:[col0] Actually, I’ll head out now. I’m not really in the mood to deal with Rufus. Good luck with him and finding your toys!
[col1]You:[col0] Cats can be so strange sometimes...
[col1]Cecile:[col0] I know, right? But it was worth a shot talking to her. Anyway, let’s get back to it and talk to Rufus. Maybe he can help us track down those toys.
[col1]Mia:[col0] Hold on! Did I hear treats? Why didn’t you mention that earlier? I can dig up more information if you offer me some treats in exchange.
[i]I can either give the treats to Mia so she can investigate the situation for us or hand them over to Rufus before confronting him about the paw prints. I’ll...[/i]
...save them to give to Rufus later.
[col1]You:[col0] Thanks for offering to dig deeper, Mia, but I’m going to hold onto these for Rufus.
[col1]Mia:[col0] Got it! I’ll head out now. Good luck with Rufus and finding your toys.
[col1]Mia:[col0] Great! I'll be back in a few hours.

[col1]Mia:[col0] Here’s what I discovered: I can guarantee Rufus didn’t steal your toys. After reviewing the security camera footage, I saw that while he was watching something near your house, he never actually went inside. You might want to ask him what he was observing and see if he has any clues. Hope that helps. Good luck! See you!
[col1]You:[col0] Wow, how does she manage that security camera stuff?
[col1]Cecile:[col0] I know, right? She’s impressive. Anyway, let’s get back to it and talk to Rufus. Maybe he can help us track down those toys.
[i]This is a tough spot. I really don’t want to end up as dog food! I wish I hadn’t given Cecile my treats, as I could’ve used them to smooth things over with Rufus before bringing it up.[/i]
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Ugh, those puppy eyes won't work on me—I’m not a human, silly. Alright, let’s go outside and ask the neighbors if they saw anything.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Hey Rufus! How’s it going, buddy?
[col1]Rufus:[col0] Get off my lawn, you trespassers! What do you want?
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Cool it, you brute! Is that any way to treat someone as lovely as me?
[col1]You:[col0] Heeeeeeey! Everyone, calm down. That wasn’t cool on our part to drop by unannounced, but we really need to talk to you...
...Here, take these treats as an apology from us.
[col1]Rufus:[col0] Alright, let’s make this quick. My owner won’t be thrilled to see you here. What do you want from me?

[col1]You:[col0] Someone stole our toys. We know it wasn’t you, but we did see you in our backyard recently, watching something, or someone. Can you tell us what you saw? We’re trying to get our toys back.

[col1]Rufus:[col0] A small animal passed through my backyard, so I followed them into yours to see what they were up to. They then ran off to the park. I tried to follow, but I’m not in the best shape and couldn’t catch up. That’s all I know. Now, please leave.
[col1]You:[col0] Got it! Thanks a lot for your time and help. We’re heading out now. Feel free to drop by our house sometime so we can share some treats!
[col1]You:[col0] He was more cooperative than I was expecting... Still pretty intimidating, though.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Yeah. With this new information, what do you think we should do next?
...He mentioned a small animal, right? Mia’s the only one who also saw it. Could it have been her?
...He mentioned it was a small animal, right? Let’s head to the park and look for it.
...Do you think we might find any more clues at our house?
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Look! It's Rick! He's always hanging around the park and might have noticed something. Let's go talk to him!
[col1]You:[col0] Oh yeah! I remember Rick. It's been a while since I last talked to him. Let's go!
[col1]Rick:[col0] Oh! Hello, Cooper and Cecile! It's been a while since you last came to the park! I'm so happy to see you!
[col1]You:[col0] We were out of town for a few days. You won't believe what happened... Someone stole my toys!

[col1]Cecile:[col0] We searched the entire house, talked to Mia, and even went to Rufus's place for clues. Unfortunately, we found nothing, except that Rufus mentioned seeing a small animal running around the neighborhood before it fled to the park.
[col1]Rick:[col0] Oh no! I’m so sorry to hear that! What are you planning to do next?
...we came to check if you’ve noticed anything suspicious around the park in the past few days.
...we're heading to the woods to see if a wild animal might have taken the toys there.

[col1]Rick:[col0] Hmm, Cecile mentioned a small animal, didn’t she? There was some commotion a few days ago. Apparently, a group of puppies got separated from their mom and caused all sorts of trouble around the neighborhood. I think some of them ended up being adopted by an old lady who lives in a cabin in the woods. I'll take you there!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Wait, are you serious? We’re actually heading into the woods? Isn’t that really dangerous?
[col1]Rick:[col0] Yes, it can be a bit dangerous, but don’t worry. I know my way around and will guide you safely.
[col1]Rick:[col0] Oh, I see. Guys, I’ve got to go. My owner’s calling me. Good luck finding the toys, and be careful in the woods!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Alright, Rick! See you later! And Cooper... seriously? Are we really going into the woods?
[col1]You:[col0] The toys aren’t in the neighborhood or the park, so they must be in the woods.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Alright, Cooper, but I’m not going too deep into the woods!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] We searched the entire house, talked to Mia, and even went to Rufus's place for clues. Unfortunately, we found nothing.
[col1]Rick:[col0] Oh no! I’m so sorry to hear that! What are you planning to do next?
[col1]You:[col0] Actually, we came to check if you’ve noticed anything suspicious around the park in the past few days.
[col1]Rick:[col0] I don’t recall anything specific. I’m sorry, but I don’t think I can help you.

Realizing they were chasing a problem that wouldn’t be solved soon with the few clues they had, our friends decided it was time to stop and move on with their lives.

Press [col1]\[Space][col0] to restart the game to collect additional clues and uncover who took Cooper’s toys.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Come on, Cooper! Not again! You’ve had me search the house a dozen times. Let’s just go to the park instead.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Highly unlikely. Cats like to play with wool or other cat things, not with dog toys. I suggest we head to the park and search for more clues there.
[col1]You:[col0] Someone took our toys, and we noticed you in our backyard recently. We’re wondering if you have them or if you know who does.
[col1]Rufus:[col0] I didn’t take anything. I don’t have time for this conversation. Leave!
[col1]You:[col0] Alright, we are leaving. Thank you for your help!
[col1]You:[col0] Ugh, he was completely uncooperative with us. And yeah, very intimidating.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Yeah... What do you think we should do next?
...The only other clue we have so far are the paw prints. Let’s head to the park!
...Do you think we might find any more clues at our house?
[col1]Rufus:[col0] My owner won’t be too happy to see you here, but since you brought my favorite treats, I’ll take the risk. Let’s make this quick. What do you need from me?
[i]Darn... those treats would’ve been really useful right about now.[/i]
[col1]You:[col0] Heeeeeeey! Everyone, calm down. That wasn’t cool on our part to drop by unannounced, but we really need to talk to you... We are sorry, okay?
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Okay, we’ve got three paths to choose from. Which one should we explore first?
[i]We won’t get far on any of these paths... Hopefully, we find something useful close by. Let’s...
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Alright, let’s head back. There’s nothing here.
[i]The left path led to nothing of interest. Maybe we should try another path. What about...
[col1]You:[col0] Well, there is only one path remaining. Let's turn right!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Also nothing. Well, we gave it our best shot, Cooper. I don’t think it’s worth going any further. Let’s head back home. Don’t worry, you’ll get new toys eventually, okay?

Realizing they were chasing a problem that wouldn’t be solved soon with the few clues they had, our friends decided it was time to stop and move on with their lives.

Press [col1]\[Space][col0] to restart the game to collect additional clues and uncover who took Cooper’s toys.
[col1]You:[col0] Well, there is only one path remaining. Let's go straight ahead!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Alright, let’s head back. There’s nothing here.
[i]The middle path led to nothing of interest. Maybe we should try another path. What about...
[col1]You:[col0] Well, there is only one path remaining. Let's turn right!
[col1]You:[col0] Well, there is only one path remaining. Let's turn left!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Alright, let’s head back. There’s nothing here.
[i]The right path led to nothing of interest. Maybe we should try another path. What about...
[col1]You:[col0] Well, there is only one path remaining. Let's go straight ahead!
[col1]You:[col0] Well, there is only one path remaining. Let's turn left!

[col1]Rick:[col0] There are three main paths to choose from, but none of them will lead to anything significant. Instead, we should go through those big trees, and we’ll soon come across a small cabin.
[col1]Cecile:[col0] The cabin belonging to the lady you mentioned, right?
[col1]You:[col0] Wait, look! There are some puppies over there!
[col1]Cecile:[col0] Cooper! Are those your toys with that puppy? Let’s talk to him and find out.
[col1]Cooper:[col0] Hey, buddy! Can you come over here for a minute?
[col1]Cooper:[col0] Where did you get those toys?

[col1]Puppy:[col0] I got separated from my mom and felt really lonely. I found these toys in a nearby backyard and took them to play with, hoping it would help me forget how much I missed her. These are your toys, aren’t they? I’m really sorry. You can have them back, of course. I won't do it again.

[col1]Cooper:[col0] Hey, you shouldn’t have taken those toys without asking. They aren’t yours, and that’s not the right thing to do. But I understand why you did it, and I’m really sorry you got separated from your mom. At least you’re with a kind human now, right?
[col1]Puppy:[col0] Yes, I am! Actually, my mom has been living here too for the past few days. I’m really happy about it.

[col1]Cooper:[col0] That’s great to hear! You can keep the toys, okay? I hope you have a lot of fun with them. And hey, why don’t you come over to our place sometime? We can play together and share some snacks. How does that sound?
[col1]Puppy:[col0] Really? Wow, thanks so much! You’re the best.

Our friends headed back home, happy they found the toys and did the right thing. The little puppy needed them more than they did. Plus, they made new friends to play with at the park. Everyone came out a winner.

Press [col1]\[Space][col0] to restart the game...
